pullRequest.body:
Go through all the files with porting notes along the lines of "was `simp`", "was `simp_rw`", "used to be `simp`" and try to:
 * Restore original, if possible;
 * Use another cleaner way to solve the issue;
 * Delete the note if it's not worth going back to the old version;
 * Renumber the note if it's a more applicable issue (#11119 in particular);
 * Or not touch the note if it's still relevant.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [7201ced2b5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17827/commits/7201ced2b589a02d238b2270003b3e5f3b3c2435)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
(I trust you, and did not verify, that you really caught all such notes.)
bors d+

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11381590478/job/31663314807)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11381590478/job/31663314455)

Looks very nice, thank you! One or two comments - but this is good enough for a(nother) maintainer to take a look.
maintainer merge

I'll let @grunweg decide whether to apply these suggestions.

bors d=@grunweg
Just flagging this for reviewers --- in case this fix reveals something else should be fixed. (The other places are very clearly not of that form.) By itself, this diff looks perfectly fine.
Nice golf!
I don't have a strong opinion if this proof or its version prior to this PR is preferable. Same for the other change in this file.

Agreed, this was probably too much unthinkingly changing everything back.
```suggestion
  rw [prod_apply hs]
```
Does `simpa` work here?

Only with some tweaking to the `eq_comm` and the `mem_bot` so it rewrites the right things:
```suggestion
    simpa [eq_comm (a := ‚ä•), span_singleton_eq_bot, mem_bot] using x_mem
```
(Feel free to apply this change if you think it really is better.)
I see. In that case, the current proof is fine!

```suggestion
    rw [prod_apply hs]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: clean up "was simp" porting notes
